title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Polluted weapons factory begins locking up nuclear waste in glass
items.description: After years of delay and political wrangling, DOE’s Hanford site opens vitrification plant

items.title: Poisonous sacs helped toads conquer the world
items.description: Iconic amphibians took an unexpected path across the globe, study finds—with toxins as a “game changer”

items.title: Did lead poisoning doom Neanderthals?
items.description: Modern humans’ tolerance for the toxic metal may have helped them outcompete our closest evolutionary cousins

items.title: An ancient cousin to humans probably built tools with its huge hands
items.description: New fossils reveal Paranthropus had massive yet dexterous hands

items.title: Chicago’s beloved ‘rat hole’ was actually made by a squirrel
Ancient chewing gum could reveal how early men and women split up their chores
items.description: Birch bark tar, used as chewing gum and glue, provides rare window into life 6000 years ago

items.title: Whiplash at CDC as hundreds of employees are terminated, then reinstated
items.description: Agency’s prestigious training programs among those spared, while other key offices are scrapped

items.title: DNA from rum-soaked fishes chronicles century of environmental change
items.description: Museum specimens collected during a 1907 marine expedition reveal loss of genetic diversity in the Philippines

items.title: Economics Nobel celebrates researchers who showed how science and technology drive growth
items.description: Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion, and Peter Howitt explained why the past 2 centuries have seen sustained economic growth rather than stagnation

items.title: As U.S. shutdown drags on, ‘it’s just one blow after another’
items.description: Federal researchers confront growing uncertainty about future
